project.name: Triangulate Mobile App
project.summary: A mobile game I made where you have to match up the colours of neighbouring shapes. Soon to be published on the Google Play Store!

children.text: Triangulate is the first mobile game I'm planning to publish to the Google Play Store. It's a 2D puzzle game where you have to tap on shapes to spin them so the neighbouring colours match. There are set levels that are handmade but also daily challenges that are generated by an algorithm. It also features leaderboards that keep track of who completed the daily challenge in the shortest time and fewest moves.

Triangulate is built using the Unity game engine and written in C#. It uses Google Play's leaderboard and sign-in to store user's scores and authenticate them. It also uses Google Anayltics to track user's activity. I also composed the sounds and music myself using Cubase.
